intro: Diplotaxis pendula var. crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved desert cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. The leaves are thick, fleshy, and succulent, adapted to store water in its native environment. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. This species is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to drought conditions.
